description: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies.  Also demonstrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
descriptionMD: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies.  Also demonstrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
name: CCNA Security (2018)
subtitle: Cisco Certified Network Associate Security

episodes.description: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies. Also demonstrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.792
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.792 --> 00:00:08.787
Hello, and thank you for
watching ITPro.TV.

3
00:00:08.787 --> 00:00:12.371
Today we're gonna be talking about
CCNA security in preparation for

4
00:00:12.371 --> 00:00:17.127
that 210-260 exam, and the fellow who's
gonna bring us all the information we need

5
00:00:17.127 --> 00:00:19.380
to know in this course in Mr. Ronnie Wong.

6
00:00:19.380 --> 00:00:22.310
And so Ronnie,
the first question I have to ask,

7
00:00:22.310 --> 00:00:25.480
who do you think should watch this show?
>> Aubri,

8
00:00:25.480 --> 00:00:26.980
that's a very good question, right?

9
00:00:26.980 --> 00:00:31.922
If you're already taking a look at
the idea of going towards a security

10
00:00:31.922 --> 00:00:37.140
focus in your career, you wanna take
a look at earning the CCNA security.

11
00:00:37.140 --> 00:00:41.242
Because it covers some of the basic
technologies that you have to be familiar

12
00:00:41.242 --> 00:00:44.750
with and how to secure them,
such as switches and routers.

13
00:00:44.750 --> 00:00:48.870
And of course, even other devices
like IPSs, as well as VPNs.

14
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:50.990
So there's a lot of
technology that's covered.

15
00:00:50.990 --> 00:00:53.720
And if you're ready to pursue that,
it means that you've already gotten

16
00:00:53.720 --> 00:00:58.390
the basic knowledge down of your
CCNA routing and switching, and

17
00:00:58.390 --> 00:01:00.010
everything that you actually need.

18
00:01:00.010 --> 00:01:01.980
And that means you're ready to
pursue a little bit further and

19
00:01:01.980 --> 00:01:04.520
a little bit deeper knowledge
in the security realm

20
00:01:04.520 --> 00:01:06.410
of what we're taking a look at.
>> So

21
00:01:06.410 --> 00:01:09.040
it sounds like this is
a certification based exam.

22
00:01:09.040 --> 00:01:11.940
Is that correct?
>> It is a certification based exam.

23
00:01:11.940 --> 00:01:16.470
As we start to take a look the idea of
certifying, though, it has a requirement,

24
00:01:16.470 --> 00:01:21.990
Aubri, and that means that you either
have the Cisco CCENT, that entry

25
00:01:21.990 --> 00:01:27.550
level certification, or you've already
earned your CCNA in routing and switching.

26
00:01:27.550 --> 00:01:30.510
And then you can take
the actual exam itself for

27
00:01:30.510 --> 00:01:34.910
the CCNA security And
once we do that, then you'll earn it.

28
00:01:34.910 --> 00:01:37.650
But if you take the CCNA
security by itself and

29
00:01:37.650 --> 00:01:41.680
you haven't got one of those other two
prerequisites, you have taken the exam but

30
00:01:41.680 --> 00:01:44.050
you will not have earned
the certification.

31
00:01:44.050 --> 00:01:46.910
So that's something we wanna make
sure that we're very careful about as

32
00:01:46.910 --> 00:01:48.650
we get started as well.

33
00:01:48.650 --> 00:01:50.360
So what are some things we're gonna cover

34
00:01:50.360 --> 00:01:52.090
in this course?
>> Well,

35
00:01:52.090 --> 00:01:55.570
in this course as we start to
cover some of the material,

36
00:01:55.570 --> 00:02:00.180
let's take a look at my machine and this
will help us out in what we're gonna do.

37
00:02:00.180 --> 00:02:02.370
Now, for the exam as we get ready for

38
00:02:02.370 --> 00:02:06.600
this, right, you do want to make sure
first and foremost that you go out and

39
00:02:06.600 --> 00:02:10.550
you get a copy of the exam
objectives directly from Cisco.

40
00:02:10.550 --> 00:02:18.088
And the way that you do that is open your
web browser and type in Exam 210/260.

41
00:02:18.088 --> 00:02:22.992
And usually one of the first two links
will end up bringing you to this

42
00:02:22.992 --> 00:02:28.010
particular web page here where
it says 210/260 IINS, okay?

43
00:02:28.010 --> 00:02:31.540
And the exam is implementing
Cisco Network Security.

44
00:02:31.540 --> 00:02:32.600
Now once you do that, right,

45
00:02:32.600 --> 00:02:35.870
you'll actually notice some of
the details about the exam as well.

46
00:02:35.870 --> 00:02:39.118
90 minutes,
60 to 70 questions here that you'll do.

47
00:02:39.118 --> 00:02:45.010
You'll also have to go to a particular
Pearson Vue Center here to take the exam.

48
00:02:45.010 --> 00:02:48.033
And you can register at vue.com,
V-U-E.com, and

49
00:02:48.033 --> 00:02:51.070
they'll walk you through
the registration process.

50
00:02:51.070 --> 00:02:53.900
You'll pick the vendor,
which going to be Cisco, and

51
00:02:53.900 --> 00:02:55.630
then the exam that you wanna take.

52
00:02:55.630 --> 00:02:57.420
And you'll be able to
register through there.

53
00:02:57.420 --> 00:03:01.020
But make sure you check that
out on the actual site itself

54
00:03:01.020 --> 00:03:03.890
because that's gonna be
very important to do so.

55
00:03:03.890 --> 00:03:08.330
Now the other thing you also want to know,
too, is going to be the cost for

56
00:03:08.330 --> 00:03:09.490
this exam.

57
00:03:09.490 --> 00:03:12.400
As of the last time that
it was checked it was

58
00:03:12.400 --> 00:03:16.400
right about $300 to take
this exam in US dollars.

59
00:03:16.400 --> 00:03:20.730
So check your regional area
when you go and do this and

60
00:03:20.730 --> 00:03:24.100
when you go to Pearson Vue it will tell
you exactly how much the exam is gonna be.

61
00:03:24.100 --> 00:03:28.540
You have to pay the fee and then you'll
be registered for that exam too.

62
00:03:28.540 --> 00:03:31.282
Now, the reason why that's important
is you want to show up for

63
00:03:31.282 --> 00:03:32.905
that exam about 15 minutes early.

64
00:03:32.905 --> 00:03:37.690
They are going to need you to bring
a ID with you and you'll be ready to go.

65
00:03:37.690 --> 00:03:41.300
And they'll tell you all the rules and
regulations there, what you can bring in,

66
00:03:41.300 --> 00:03:43.194
what you can't bring into the exam booth.

67
00:03:43.194 --> 00:03:46.910
So make sure you pay attention
to some of those details.

68
00:03:46.910 --> 00:03:51.870
Now in our show, right, for
our CCNA security, we'll be covering all

69
00:03:51.870 --> 00:03:57.590
the technologies that you see listed right
here, okay, in this list that we see.

70
00:03:57.590 --> 00:04:01.603
But to ensure that we're covering
everything else that we also need, too,

71
00:04:01.603 --> 00:04:06.440
notice that here's a link down here at the
bottom that says Review the exam topics.

72
00:04:06.440 --> 00:04:13.951
And if I select that link, that will, of
course, bring me to the IINS exam topics.

73
00:04:13.951 --> 00:04:19.960
And I'll see a collapsed list of
the overall topics that will be covered.

74
00:04:19.960 --> 00:04:24.620
And notice that there are seven different
domains that you have to cover anywhere

75
00:04:24.620 --> 00:04:29.073
ranging between what looks like 10%
all the way up to about 20%, okay,

76
00:04:29.073 --> 00:04:32.390
somewhere around there,
in terms of the coverage.

77
00:04:32.390 --> 00:04:35.530
And then if you wanna see what's gonna
be covered in terms of technology,

78
00:04:35.530 --> 00:04:38.570
you can expand out
the actual details here.

79
00:04:38.570 --> 00:04:42.390
And we'll be covering each one of
these to make sure that we get you all

80
00:04:42.390 --> 00:04:45.220
the knowledge that you need to prepare for
the exam as well.

81
00:04:45.220 --> 00:04:49.000
Now if you're saying, hey, I don't
wanna spend all my time doing that,

82
00:04:49.000 --> 00:04:53.320
you have a link that says to download
the complete topics in a PDF format.

83
00:04:53.320 --> 00:04:57.170
And when you do that,
then you will actually get a copy and

84
00:04:57.170 --> 00:04:59.910
it will look pretty much like this, okay?

85
00:04:59.910 --> 00:05:03.660
This will tell you all of the exam
descriptions in the details here.

86
00:05:03.660 --> 00:05:06.710
Remember it's a 90-minute exam,
60, 70 questions.

87
00:05:06.710 --> 00:05:11.730
That gives you about a minute, maybe a
minute and 15 seconds per question or so.

88
00:05:11.730 --> 00:05:14.910
It might not even give you that much,
let's say like a minute ten or so, okay,

89
00:05:14.910 --> 00:05:15.980
per question.

90
00:05:15.980 --> 00:05:18.700
You'll need to take all your
time in doing this, and

91
00:05:18.700 --> 00:05:22.850
you'll take a look at all the concepts
that actually will be on the exam.

92
00:05:22.850 --> 00:05:24.730
They'll be listed right
here as well as other ones.

93
00:05:24.730 --> 00:05:27.910
Now, when we take a look at this, okay,

94
00:05:27.910 --> 00:05:30.970
there's a second topic that
you've got to be aware of.

95
00:05:30.970 --> 00:05:35.080
I wish I could tell you that the exam
objectives covered every single thing.

96
00:05:35.080 --> 00:05:38.590
And I could cover everything that I try to
actually think about when preparing for

97
00:05:38.590 --> 00:05:45.140
this show, but the very fact is it's kind
of the strange last phrase here, okay?

98
00:05:45.140 --> 00:05:49.840
The guidelines may change
without any notice at all, okay?

99
00:05:49.840 --> 00:05:51.780
And that can be a little bit scary, but

100
00:05:51.780 --> 00:05:56.290
if we cover the exam objectives that
should be more than sufficient for you.

101
00:05:56.290 --> 00:06:00.420
Also, of course, study and
prepare for the exam.

102
00:06:00.420 --> 00:06:04.255
So don't think that you won't
be able to cover everything, but

103
00:06:04.255 --> 00:06:06.880
you'll at least be able to
cover as much as we can do

104
00:06:06.880 --> 00:06:10.120
as of what we've actually done for
this show at this point.

105
00:06:10.120 --> 00:06:14.380
So during our show, we'll end up seeing,
of course, well, basic security concepts.

106
00:06:14.380 --> 00:06:17.420
We'll make sure that we go over these,
that you have a good understanding of

107
00:06:17.420 --> 00:06:22.980
the Cisco terminology on all the security
concepts that they want you to understand.

108
00:06:22.980 --> 00:06:25.640
Make sure that we review those
concepts very well for you.

109
00:06:25.640 --> 00:06:29.150
And we'll have some lab
work that we can also see.

110
00:06:29.150 --> 00:06:32.850
And then, of course,
we begin to secure access, right?

111
00:06:32.850 --> 00:06:36.960
Make sure that we understand how
do we secure management access.

112
00:06:36.960 --> 00:06:42.740
How do we actually implement authorization
and accounting and authentication as well?

113
00:06:42.740 --> 00:06:47.117
And introduce, of course,
mutual authentication, 802.1x,

114
00:06:47.117 --> 00:06:52.325
being able to set that up, as well as talk
about the security policies around BYOD.

115
00:06:52.325 --> 00:06:57.477
We'll spend a good deal of time
in creating VPNs where we'll

116
00:06:57.477 --> 00:07:02.127
create a site-to-site as
well as a site-to-client

117
00:07:02.127 --> 00:07:06.790
VPN connection and
even a client list VPN connection.

118
00:07:06.790 --> 00:07:09.910
We'll make sure you have
the details behind doing that.

119
00:07:09.910 --> 00:07:12.900
We'll show you how to secure,
of course, routing and switching.

120
00:07:12.900 --> 00:07:17.360
This is why it's essential that you
have the basic knowledge of the CCENT or

121
00:07:17.360 --> 00:07:19.400
the CCNA routing and switching.

122
00:07:19.400 --> 00:07:20.620
If you don't know how those work,

123
00:07:20.620 --> 00:07:22.430
you're not gonna be able to
secure routing protocols.

124
00:07:22.430 --> 00:07:26.370
You're not gonna understand the idea
of securing the switch itself

125
00:07:26.370 --> 00:07:29.560
if you don't understand
the basics of actually how to

126
00:07:29.560 --> 00:07:34.700
run some of those configurations on
a switch or a router, too, okay?

127
00:07:34.700 --> 00:07:38.870
And of course, we'll spend a good deal of
time in configuring the Cisco firewall.

128
00:07:38.870 --> 00:07:42.880
Now traditionally this has been
based off of the Cisco iOS firewall,

129
00:07:42.880 --> 00:07:46.430
which means it's in
the router itself on the iOS.

130
00:07:46.430 --> 00:07:51.050
And we'll take a look at how we actually
configure certain things there, too.

131
00:07:51.050 --> 00:07:53.960
And of course, also the Cisco ASA.

132
00:07:53.960 --> 00:07:57.220
Spend a good deal of
time in configuring that

133
00:07:57.220 --> 00:08:02.200
as well as implementing a zone-based
firewall on a Cisco iOS device, too.

134
00:08:02.200 --> 00:08:06.370
We'll take a look at all the different
security features that we'll also find

135
00:08:06.370 --> 00:08:10.350
in setting up a Cisco ASA for
its first and initial use.

136
00:08:10.350 --> 00:08:15.434
And we'll of course talk about the idea
here of the Modular Policy Framework.

137
00:08:15.434 --> 00:08:17.980
It's an important concept
that we'll introduce.

138
00:08:17.980 --> 00:08:22.190
And make sure that you understand as we
go through the Cisco ASA configuration.

139
00:08:22.190 --> 00:08:27.740
We'll spend a brief bit of time
here in the domain 6 here on IPS.

140
00:08:27.740 --> 00:08:30.400
Now, notice the verb changes
to the word describe.

141
00:08:30.400 --> 00:08:32.680
And that means a lot of
the concepts that we have here,

142
00:08:32.680 --> 00:08:35.700
well, just make sure that you have
a good descriptive knowledge.

143
00:08:35.700 --> 00:08:40.099
When I say that, we're also gonna
be taking a look at the idea of

144
00:08:40.099 --> 00:08:44.678
configuring a Cisco IPS by command
line on a Cisco router itself.

145
00:08:44.678 --> 00:08:46.560
So don't think that we're
skipping over that.

146
00:08:46.560 --> 00:08:49.230
And the other technology that
we'll also be taking a look at,

147
00:08:49.230 --> 00:08:53.710
of course, is configuring, well,
policies here or IPS policies

148
00:08:53.710 --> 00:08:58.470
on the actual Firepower Management Center
for our next generation IPS as well.

149
00:08:58.470 --> 00:09:01.000
And we'll show you how to
actually get through and

150
00:09:01.000 --> 00:09:02.760
at least understand the concepts.

151
00:09:02.760 --> 00:09:05.540
That one, most home users
are probably not gonna buy that

152
00:09:05.540 --> 00:09:07.660
because that's a pretty expensive product.

153
00:09:07.660 --> 00:09:12.031
But at least you'll see a demonstration
on how that would end up working, too.

154
00:09:12.031 --> 00:09:15.320
Now the last domain objective
is relatively small.

155
00:09:15.320 --> 00:09:18.920
And it's just reviewing
basic concepts of security

156
00:09:18.920 --> 00:09:21.960
such as how do we secure against
email threats and web threats.

157
00:09:21.960 --> 00:09:25.630
And of course, even point threats
from the Cisco perspective.

158
00:09:25.630 --> 00:09:27.960
Not everybody on the planet's prospective,
but

159
00:09:27.960 --> 00:09:32.230
Cisco's technology which only means not a
lot more money coming out of your pocket.

160
00:09:32.230 --> 00:09:33.946
But we'll make sure that we show you, or

161
00:09:33.946 --> 00:09:37.174
at least talk to you about the products
that are actually going to be there for

162
00:09:37.174 --> 00:09:40.690
you, and talk about when they're
actually going to be used as well.

163
00:09:40.690 --> 00:09:44.160
So all that together will help us
get a better understanding, and

164
00:09:44.160 --> 00:09:47.420
to get prepared for
the actual exam itself.

165
00:09:47.420 --> 00:09:52.380
And throughout our entire series, we'll
be doing a lot of lab work as we do so.

166
00:09:52.380 --> 00:09:56.040
You've got to actually have the lab
work in or some of the concepts that we

167
00:09:56.040 --> 00:09:58.840
mentioned and how to configure it and
what's going to be happening.

168
00:09:58.840 --> 00:10:00.490
They're not gonna make sense to you, nor

169
00:10:00.490 --> 00:10:02.199
are you going to get prepared for
the exam.

170
00:10:02.199 --> 00:10:04.330
And make sure you set
up your own lab work.

171
00:10:04.330 --> 00:10:06.511
If you're an ITPro.TV subscriber,

172
00:10:06.511 --> 00:10:10.550
you have access to the exact same
equipment that I use during our show.

173
00:10:10.550 --> 00:10:14.430
That means you can also get the same
configurations on yours where it's

174
00:10:14.430 --> 00:10:15.460
applicable.

175
00:10:15.460 --> 00:10:18.200
Some things you won't be able
to recreate on your own.

176
00:10:18.200 --> 00:10:20.552
I wish I could say that we
could do everything, but

177
00:10:20.552 --> 00:10:23.360
some things I had to actually
do on my own as well.

178
00:10:23.360 --> 00:10:26.480
Though you'll follow the best
that you can on those situations.

179
00:10:26.480 --> 00:10:28.930
But Aubri,
when it comes down to the exam and

180
00:10:28.930 --> 00:10:33.000
what we'll be actually covering at this
point, right, that will pretty much make

181
00:10:33.000 --> 00:10:36.690
sure that we get a good coverage
of all the exam objectives.

182
00:10:36.690 --> 00:10:41.760
And that, along with your own personal
time that you put into studying,

183
00:10:41.760 --> 00:10:45.940
will help you to succeed as you
get ready for that INS exam.

184
00:10:45.940 --> 00:10:49.398
So don't skimp,
take all the time you need.

185
00:10:49.398 --> 00:10:52.459
Because when it comes down to exam day,
that's the only way you're

186
00:10:52.459 --> 00:10:55.520
going to get prepared for it,
is to make sure you understand each and

187
00:10:55.520 --> 00:10:59.260
every one of these topics and the concepts
behind them before you move on.

188
00:10:59.260 --> 00:11:02.050
So my recommendation is,
as you watch the show, make sure you don't

189
00:11:02.050 --> 00:11:06.510
move on to next topic until you fully
understand that domain objective, and

190
00:11:06.510 --> 00:11:08.040
make sure that you actually have it down.

191
00:11:08.040 --> 00:11:11.170
Don't skip as it actually
builds upon each other as well.

192
00:11:11.170 --> 00:11:15.270
So be sure you take some time and
look over everything that we have.

193
00:11:15.270 --> 00:11:19.590
And of course, watch every single episode
that we have right here on the ITPro.TV

194
00:11:19.590 --> 00:11:23.280
library as you get started as well.
>> All right, thank you, Ronnie.

195
00:11:23.280 --> 00:11:29.590
If CCNA Security Exam 210-260 in
our course library interests you,

196
00:11:29.590 --> 00:11:32.510
be sure to watch every single
episode like Ronnie said.

197
00:11:32.510 --> 00:11:33.645
Thanks for watching.

198
00:11:33.645 --> 00:11:34.145
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss the cia triad and siem technology.  They describe the components and purpose of the CIA triad and provide examples for each component.  Also they take the time to describe SIEM technology and talk about what it does and should perform: aggregation, correlation and retention.
episodes.title: Describe CIA Triad and SIEM Technology

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss the cia triad and siem technology.  They describe the components and purpose of the CIA triad and provide examples for each component.  Also they take the time to describe SIEM technology and talk about what it does and should perform: aggregation, correlation and retention.
episodes.title: Describe CIA Triad and SIEM Technology Pt2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss common security terms which the security analyst should know for the exam but as foundational knowledge before the deeper dive into network security implementations.
episodes.title: Identify Common Security Terms

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie review reconnaissance attack methods.  They describe the use of this attack and some of the methods of attack. The team emphasizes the need for the IT security professional to be aware of these
episodes.title: Describe Common Network Attacks

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie review some of most common network security attacks that a security analyst should be able to identify and understand their basic function.  The team help to define not only the categories of attacks but also some specific attacks that IT Security pros should be able to understand.
episodes.title: Describe Common Network Attacks Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie review some of most common network security attacks that a security analyst should be able to identify and understand their basic function.  The team help to define not only the categories of attacks but also some specific attacks that IT Security pros should be able to understand.
episodes.title: Describe Common Network Attacks Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie identify common malware types. The team discuss their basic working and some of the different examples of them.  They discuss the changes in how malware has been used in the past vs today.
episodes.title: Identify Common Malware Types

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie take a look at different ways in which data can be removed from an organization.  They discuss the purpose of DLP.  How those policies are key for an organization today.
episodes.title: Classify Data Loss Vectors

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss encryption methods.  They review their purpose in security and the different types of encryptions used.  They discuss how they function and why they are used.
episodes.title: Describe Encryption Methods

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss encryption methods.  They review their purpose in security and the different types of encryptions used.  They discuss how they function and why they are used.
episodes.title: Describe Encryption Methods Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie take a little bit of time to describe the process of crypto key exchange.  The discuss why it matters and how important it is to keep the keys private. They also describe how digitial signature are created and what protectiosn it affords as well as the issuance of certificates and the PKI.
episodes.title: Describe Crypto Key Exchange

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie take a little bit of time to describe the process of crypto key exchange.  The discuss why it matters and how important it is to keep the keys private. They also describe how digitial signature are created and what protectiosn it affords as well as the issuance of certificates and the PKI.
episodes.title: Describe Crypto Key Exchange Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie take the time to review some network topologies.  They discuss the need to understand the topology to help with the identifying the scope for the IT security professsional.  The describe each type and some of the details of each topology.
episodes.title: Describe Network Topologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie pick up from where they left off in part 1. The team discuss the SOHO and Cloud topologies.  They review the security of virtual environments and discuss who is responsible for the security in these types of enivironments.
episodes.title: Describe Network Topologies Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss the methods of managing networking equipment. The describe and compare both in-band and out-of-band management of devices. They take a look at both approaches and then also demonstrate what is normally meant by both.
episodes.title: Compare In-band and Out-of-band Mgmt

episodes.description: In this epsiode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to configure and verify secure management.  They demonstrate how to use the autosecure feature using `auto secure` and walk through the configuration setup
episodes.title: Configure and Verify Secure Mgmt

episodes.description: Description: In this epsiode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to configure and verify secure management.  They demonstrate how to use the autosecure feature using `auto secure` and walk through the configuration setup.
episodes.title: Configure and Verify Secure Mgmt Part 2

episodes.description: In this epsiode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to secre access to the management plane.  They discuss the configuration and different ways this controls access to the management plane.  The team then configures a router for secure access and how to protect the router from deletion of the Cisco IOS.
episodes.title: Secure Management Plane Access

episodes.description: In this epsiode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to secre access to the management plane.  They discuss the configuration and different ways this controls access to the management plane.  The team then configures a router for secure access and how to protect the router from deletion of the Cisco IOS.
episodes.title: Secure Management Plane Access Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review the SNMP versions briefly and discuss the advantages of SNMPv3 over the other versions. The team discuss briefly the SNMPv3 components. They configure SNMPv3 with an access control list to secure SNMP and verify its operation.
episodes.title: Configure and Verify SNMPv3

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain the importance of NTP.  The team also discuss some of the issues with NTP and how it works.  Lastly, they configure and verify how NTP can be configured with security.
episodes.title: Configure and Verify NTP Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain the importance of NTP.  The team also discuss some of the issues with NTP and how it works.  Lastly, they configure and verify how NTP can be configured with security.
episodes.title: Configure and Verify NTP Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the AAA frame work used for securing access. The guys describe basic access, local security and aaa new-model.  They compare RADIUS and TACACS+ attributes.
episodes.title: Describe AAA Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the drawbacks of local authentication.  They show how to overcomes some of these drawbacks by using a remote authentication server like tacacs+.  They demonstrate how to configure the router to use TACACS+ with a TACACS+ server and verify it for authentication and authorization
episodes.title: Configure Access Using TACACSplus

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the drawbacks of local authentication.  They show how to overcomes some of these drawbacks by using a remote authentication server like tacacs+.  They demonstrate how to configure the router to use TACACS+ with a TACACS+ server and verify it for authentication and authorization
episodes.title: Configure Access Using TACACSplus Part 2

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the need to transfer files. They discuss the need to use more secure way to transfer files.  Using NYEDGE2, they configure NYEDGE2 as the SCP server and PLABCSCO01 as the SCP client and show how to transfer a file using SCP.
episodes.title: Use SCP For File Transfer

episodes.description: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies.  Also demostrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
episodes.title: Explain AD Integration With AAA

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the need and uses of ISE for Network Access Control.  The guys breakdown what it can do and how it works.  The team also point out the use of Cisco's ACS server by comparison and it's working. Also noted is that the ACS is at the end of life as a product for Cisco now.
episodes.title: Describe Using Cisco ACS and ISE

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss 802.1x Port-Based Authentication.  They discuss how it restricts unauthorized clients from connecting through publicly accessible ports. The team show how to configure a router for 802.1x authentication.
episodes.title: Identify 802.1x Components and Functions

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie disucss the basics of BYOB.  They describe the need for it as well as the purpose of the Cisco BYOB Security Architecture.  Also, they talk about how mobile device management systems fit in the framework of BYOB.
episodes.title: Describe BYOD Framework and MDM

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe use of IPsec as a framework.  They discuss that IPsec is comprised of matching hashing algorithm, authentication, DH group #, limited availability,and encryption.  They describe what is involved with Phase 1 (SA) and Phase 2 (encryption).
episodes.title: Describe IPsec Protocols and Modes

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe use of IPsec as a framework.  They discuss that IPsec is comprised of matching hashing algorithm, authentication, DH group #, limited availability,and encryption.  They describe what is involved with Phase 1 (SA) and Phase 2 (encryption).
episodes.title: Describe VPN Implementations

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to implement a remote access VPN using a clientlesss SSL VPN on a Cisco ASA.  They configure this VPN throough the ASDM.  Also they verify that the VPN is in working condition.
episodes.title: Setup Clientless SSL VPN Using ASDM

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie use the ASDM to configure Anyconnect VPN on a Cisco ASA firewall. They show how challenging this implementation can be and how to reconfigure it to work correctly.  Lastly, look at the use of the components of enpoint posture assessments.
episodes.title: Setup AnyConnect VPN Using ASDM

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie verify  Anyconnect VPN configuration on a Cisco ASA firewall. They show how it use from the client side and connect to verify connection.  Lastly, look at the use of the components of enpoint posture assessments.
episodes.title: Setup AnyConnect VPN Using ASDM Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the basics of creating a site to site vpn.  The team also discusses that site-to-site vpns will not always be between 2 routers as well.  They walk through configuring one side of a router configuration and explain the process too.
episodes.title: Setup IPsec Site-to-Site VPN with PSK

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show the mirror configuration of the site-to-site vpn.  The guys re-explain the process and provide guidance on gotchas and other elements that can cause the tunnel not to build.  They walk through configuring the other side of a router configuration.
episodes.title: Setup IPsec Site-to-Site VPN with PSK Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie review basic secure router access.  They show how to secure the CLI using multiple privilege levesl and configure role based access.  The team shows how to add users with different privilege levels for control and create a view for the role based congtrols.
episodes.title: Secure CLI Access and IOS

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie configure OSPF authentication using MD5.  The guys discuss the goals of configuring authentication and display how vulnerable the routing protocol can be. Lastly, they demonstration how to secure ospf.
episodes.title: Setup OSPF Authentication with MD5

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe the use of EIGRP authentication with MD5. They describe the prerequisites needed to setup authentication between routers. They also review the basic weakness without authentication.  They demonstrate how to configure and verify it between routers.
episodes.title: Setup EIGRP Authentication with MD5

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some fo the most common Layer 2 attacks.  They describe STP attacks, Layer 2 Spoofing and overflows at Layer 2 The team also discusses that a security professional must be able to identify and spot these types layer two attacks.
episodes.title: Setup L2 Attack Mitigation

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some fo the most common Layer 2 attacks.  They describe STP attacks, Layer 2 Spoofing, Overflows at Layer 2, CDP reconnaisance, VLAN Hopping and DHCP Spoofing. The team also discusses that a security professional must be able to identify and spot these types layer two attacks.
episodes.title: Setup L2 Attack Mitigation Part 2

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some fo the most common Layer 2 attacks.  They describe CDP reconnaisance, VLAN Hopping and DHCP Spoofing. The team also discusses that a security professional must be able to identify and spot these types layer two attacks.
episodes.title: Setup L2 Attack Mitigation Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie take just a moment to discuss the control plane policy. The team also tell us about the security risk without configuring CoPP. They setup CoPP on the router and verify that it's working too.
episodes.title: Explain Control Plane Policing

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the use of Private VLANs and show how to configure it.  The guys emphasize the terminology used when describing and configuring on a switch.  They then show how to configure and verify it working.
episodes.title: Setup PVLANs for L2 Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the native vlan security issues.  The team describe the confusion of using VLAN1. The guys also discuss the purpose of the native VLAN. Lastly, they demonstrate the default vlan and configuring the native vlan on a switch and what happens when switches have different vlans but connected by trunk ports.
episodes.title: Describe Native VLAN Security Issues

episodes.description: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies.  Also demostrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
episodes.title: Describe Different Firewall Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the setting up Policy Based NAT on a Cisco ASA running version 9+.  They show of the configuration detail throught the ASDM.  Lastly, they demonstrate how to configure Policy NAT on the Cisco ASA.
episodes.title: Implement NAT on Cisco ASA 9.x

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue setting up Policy Based NAT on a Cisco ASA running version 9+.  Lastly, they verify the Policy NAT on the Cisco ASA. The team emphasizes that the CLI configuration is important for the exam but the viewer shouldn't ignore the fact that this can be configured in the ASDM
episodes.title: Implement NAT on Cisco ASA 9.x Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie take a look at using ZBFW, Zone Base Firewall on a Cisco IOS router.  They discuss the reason to use zones.  The team also discusses the use of zone pairs.  Using a Zone to Zone pair, they demonstrate how to configure for a zone based firewall.
episodes.title: Setup Zone Based Firewall: Zone to Zone

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie take a look at using ZBFW, Zone Base Firewall on a Cisco IOS router. Using the zone configured router they show that a self zone exist and what it represents.  If the self zone is not configured in a zone-pair there will be no connection to the router. The team also discusses that the setup is still the same as zone-to-zone.  Using a self  to Zone pairing, they demonstrate how to configure it to control what the router can reach.
episodes.title: Setup Zone Based Firewall: Self Zone

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie look into how to ocnfigure access management on a Cisco ASA with version 9.x.  The duo show how to configure access using telnet, ssh, https and setup ASDM.
episodes.title: Configure ASA: Access Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie look into how to ocnfigure access management on a Cisco ASA with version 9.x.  The duo show how to configure dynamic nat and security access policies to allow for connections through the firewall allowing traffic to get access to a DMZ.
episodes.title: Configure ASA: Security Access Policies

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie look into how to configure access management on a Cisco ASA with version 9.x.  The duo show how to configure access using telnet, ssh, https and setup ASDM.
episodes.title: Configure ASA: Modular Policy Framework

episodes.description: Description: in this episode, Aubri and Ronnie describe some of the different features that can be configured on a cisco firewall.  The team show how to navigate around the cisco ASA and show where configurable elements are found. They also describe its implementation mode, security context and availability.
episodes.title: Describe Firewall Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie give consideration to deploying an IPS.  The guys describe the purpose of the IPS and different types networking professionals see on corporate type of networks.  They also describe it's deployment placement and basic functions.  Lastly, they disucss the results that can be seen when using an IPS
episodes.title: Describe IPS Deployment Considerations

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie configure the Cisco IOS-IPS from the CLI interface. Though this can be done using the CCP--Cisco Configuration Professional, the team shows how to do via the CLI and use it describe all the IPS technologies involved configuring it.
episodes.title: Configure Cisco IOS IPS

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie configure the Cisco IOS-IPS from the CLI interface. Though this can be done using the CCP--Cisco Configuration Professional, the team shows how to do via the CLI and use it describe all the IPS technologies involved configuring it.
episodes.title: Configure Cisco IOS IPS Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie use the Cisco FMC (Firewpower Management Center) to show the configuration of an intrusion policy.
episodes.title: Configure IPS Policy on Cisco FMC

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe and discuss the Cisco threat mitigation for email.  They describe the Cisco Email Cloud Security service for subscribers and the Cisco ESA.  These technologies can be combined to give a complete hybrid solutions.  They also discuss some of the details of the ESA and it's capabilities.
episodes.title: Describe Threat Mitigation for Email

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss different web threats and migitation technologies.  They describe the different Cisco technologies like Cisco Cloud Web Security and the Cisco WSA which is integrated with the Cisco AMP solutions.
episodes.title: Describe Threat Mitigation for Web

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe the common need for endpoint security.  Along with the need, they describe some of the different ways that endpoints can be secured and heavily focus on Cisco technologies like the Cisco ISE, Cisco AMP for Endpoints as well as describe what may be natively available with endpoint OSes like Windows 10.  Lastly, they describe encryption and compare hardware vs software based encryption.
episodes.title: Describe Threat Mitigation for Endpoints
